title: Education Sector Displacement by 2030
description: Projected percentage of education roles (tutoring, grading, content creation, administration) restructured or reduced by AI by 2030. Only data points where sources directly state a displacement figure are plotted.

overlays.label: OECD: 30-40% task displacement for support staff
Gartner: 20% of EdTech workforce replaced by 2028
WEF: moderate risk, core teaching protected
IMF: 60% of advanced-economy jobs exposed to AI

sources.title: Guidance for Generative AI in Education and Research
sources.excerpt: AI tutoring systems can handle 60% of routine student queries. Teaching assistants and tutors face the most immediate displacement risk.

sources.title: The Promise and Peril of AI in K-12 Education
sources.excerpt: AI grading tools can assess 80% of student work types. Administrative roles in K-12 face 15-20% reduction from automation.

sources.title: AI Tutors and the Future of Education Labor
sources.excerpt: AI tutoring achieves 98% of human tutor effectiveness for math and science. Private tutoring market projected to contract 25% by 2028.

sources.title: Chegg Q2 2024 Earnings — ChatGPT Impact on Tutoring Market
sources.excerpt: Chegg subscribers fell 50% from peak as students shifted to ChatGPT. Company laid off 23% of workforce, citing AI as primary competitive threat.

sources.title: AI Is Already Reshaping the Academic Workforce
OECD Education at a Glance 2025: AI and Teaching
sources.excerpt: Teaching roles are among the least automatable (15% task exposure), but education support staff, administration, and tutoring face 30-40% task displacement.

sources.title: Gartner Predicts AI Will Replace 20% of EdTech Workforce by 2028
sources.excerpt: Content creation, assessment grading, and student support roles are the most affected. Core teaching remains largely protected.

sources.title: Occupational Outlook: Education, Training, and Library
sources.excerpt: Teacher aide and educational support employment projected to decline 3%. Post-secondary teacher demand flat. Private tutoring category declining.

sources.title: Pearson plc 2024 Annual Report — AI Strategy
sources.excerpt: Pearson pivoted to AI-first content delivery, reducing editorial headcount by 18% while growing AI-generated adaptive learning content 300%.

sources.title: Future of Jobs Report 2025: Education Sector Analysis
sources.excerpt: Education support roles face moderate displacement risk while core teaching remains protected. Administrative and content creation roles most affected by AI adoption.

sources.title: McKinsey: 12 Million US Workers Will Need to Transition Occupations by 2030
sources.excerpt: McKinsey estimates 12 million US workers will need to transition occupations by 2030, with education support staff among the affected groups requiring reskilling.

sources.title: Bridging Skill Gaps for the Future: New Jobs Creation in the AI Age
sources.excerpt: Around 40% of global employment is exposed to AI; in advanced economies 60%. Demand for new skills is rising with 10% of jobs in advanced economies requiring at least one new skill.
